intro: Pavetta owariensis var. owariensis, commonly known as the Japanese pavetta, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the summer months.
